snippet.textDisplay:
There have been exactly *ZERO* instances of trans men/women using access to 
bathrooms in order to assault anyone...there *have* been at least three 
instances of anti-trans red-necks doing it though. I think we should ban 
all Christians from using the government to force their bullshit onto sane 
and decent Americans. The cops actually threw a woman out of a women's 
bathroom, all because she couldn't prove she was a woman...WTF NC?﻿

+Mike Stavenes I didn't say I should go to the womens bathroom. You're 
having a hard time just like last time to understand what I written. I just 
said get rid of gender bathrooms altogether and that it's pretty much a 
victory for progressive ideal so that everybody is equally comfortable or 
uncomfortable. What stereotype am I making out of Transgender? please 
explain.

Don't get confused about how this whole problem started. It started when 
the Transgendered people using the bathrooms that they weren't suppose to 
use in the first place. I be honest it makes people uncomfortable and feel 
violated. Think about it. When I go to a bathroom the level I privacy I 
expect is to do my business without a woman's presences, and as for women's 
case men. All the points that I've made are valid. Is it really that hard 
to comprehend that we do not live in a utopian society where criminals and 
predators exist. You would be naive to think that predators won't take 
advantage of a law or opportunity when presents itself. 

The part where people accuse other people for going to the wrong bathroom 
when they're actually are of the correct gender, that is result of 
Transgender people breaking the law. Why should the lifestyle of others 
should directly affect a person comfort and security? Gender assigned 
bathrooms are as simple as it gets, but Transgendered people wants to make 
it complicated. They want to push the belief that their actually women and 
for those who disagree, we're going to be called bigot. You might as well 
call the straight guys that Transgender women want to date bigots as well 
if they don't see that transgeder woman as woman because the they're 
actually a man.

Also as long as it is still illegal in my state I will continue to report 
and prevent Transgender person if they going to the wrong bathroom because 
I don't know if they're a predator or not.

+Edward Hughes 
You just said that ultimately you should be allowed to go to the women's 
bathroom, so that you can protect your family, while you take a shit...I 
agree. You *should* protect your family from all the ultra-closeted 
homophobic perverts that would try and rape your women in the 
bathroom...just leave Trans people out of it.

Because guess what buddy...Trans people have been using the bathroom of 
their choice this whole time...and no one even noticed until bigots made it 
an issue. *Now* you want to make a big deal of it, and the only people ever 
harassing women in bathrooms, continues to be *only* straight, non-trans 
perverts. I'm not really seeing where the "victory" was for Trans 
activists...and I'm certainly not seeing how the actions of non-trans 
perverts has anything to do with which bathroom Trans people decide to use.

You are literally creating a new negative stereotype, just so that you can 
bitch about something that's only happening in your mind. Does it feel 
childish? It really sounds like it should feel pretty childish.

+Mike Stavenes I didn't say it is my eventual solution where once again you 
missed my point. I meant the only way for the for your progressive victory 
is getting rid of gender bathrooms. I just want to keep shit simple as it 
has been, which is men goes to the mens room and women goes to the womens 
room. The Supreme Court decided to legalizing gay marriages on a federal 
level. So, why not the greatest law of the land decided on this bathroom 
issue that you guys are fighting so hard for. To be honest I think it is an 
issue that you want to be solved at a state level so that this whole 
Transgender issue doesn't get shut down altogether because the Supreme 
Court is going to see that the case for Transgendered people to use 
incorrect bathrooms is pretty weak compare to the strong valid arguments 
from those who oppose. I mean you struggle to refute any of my points while 
I shut yours down. You still have much to learn young Social Justice 
Warrior.

+Edward Hughes 
So your eventual solution is to let them go in whichever bathroom they 
want? Sure...knock yourself out, buddy. Why you feel the need to involve 
the highest court in the land, is still a mystery to sane people 
everywhere...but whatever floats your boat. ;-)

Maybe you're not being progressive enough. There is a neutral ground that 
we can meet at. Let's get rid of all gender bathrooms so that everyone can 
be equal. I can go into a bathroom with my wife and daughter and take a 
shit right next to them and protect them from predators at the same time.

When you think about, it sounds like a reasonable idea right? All the 
points that I've are the same points that the lawyers are going to point 
out and use. Let's have the Supreme Court decide on this issue. They're 
going to decide if the comfort of Transgendered people using the bathroom 
that the identify with is more important than the comfort of other who 
oppose, the safety of every one, and the complications that this law would 
bring. After weighing out all the points that I made vs Transgender ' s 
being comfortable, it is easy to see who side is going to win.

Maybe you're not being progressive enough. There is a neutral ground that 
we can meet at. Let's get rid of all gender bathrooms so that everyone can 
be equal. I can go into a bathroom with my wife and daughter and take a 
shit right next to them and protect them from predators at the same time.

When you think about, it sounds like a reasonable idea right? All the 
points that I've are the same points that the lawyers are going to point 
out and use. Let's have the Supreme Court decide on this issue. They're 
going to decide if the comfort of Transgendered people using the bathroom 
that the identify with is more important than the comfort of other who 
oppose, the safety of every one, and the complications that this law would 
bring. After weighing out all the points that I made vs Transgender ' s 
being comfortable, it is easy to see who side is going to win.

you probably disagree on my next point which is Transgender people are not 
really penalized for the action of predators. They can still use the 
restroom, nothing is preventing them from using it, except for themselves. 
They have a bathroom to go to, even though it may be the bathroom that they 
don't identify with. They chose to dress the way they dress and sometimes 
mutilate their bodies to be the opposite sex so they can feel comfortable 
with themselves. 

You can call me a bigot for this one, but here goes. When Transgender use a 
woman's bathroom it implies to everyone else that we need to conform to the 
belief that the Transgender person is a woman and should be treated as 
such. It's like Christians pushing their beliefs that God is real and Jesus 
is the answer. We shouldn't conform or be forced to accept a belief by 
others when there is scientific proof that they're wrong. Just like there 
is evidence of evolution would prove that God doesn't exist. That same 
reasoning can be applied to Transgender people. Biology say that person is 
the gender they're born with regardless of what the do to their bodies and 
how their mind thinks.

+Mike Stavenes look sir once again your argument is flawed. There has been 
instances were a predator used a woman's bathroom for their perverted 
purposes. a few years ago in California a man dressed as a woman and 
recorded other women using the bathroom. This shit isn't I'm my head. In 
fact like most of us who is against the idea of Transgendered using the 
incorrect bathroom expects predators to exploit this bathroom law for their 
perverted purposes because their presence in a woman's restroom won't be 
questioned.

You did prove my point that there is no way that we can't tell if a 
Transgender is a predator or if they're truly sincere about it. Like you 
said a predator can be anybody and anybody can claim to be Transgendered 
and we couldn't really prove. Which my next point would be is that this 
whole issue is a big joke. No matter how you were to write a law or how 
many times you rewrite it, there is no way to punish those who are 
insincere and takes advantage because you can't prove it. Heck you would 
have to question every Transgender you see, but that would be 
discrimination. 

Heck some one could claim that their a Transgendered woman who like to 
dress as a butch, but whose sexual orientation is lesbian. By law he should 
be allowed to go to a women's restroom. Which also brings my next point 
people who oppose would protest in that way too.

+Edward Hughes
If anyone I knew was raped in a bathroom...I would hope that the person 
who's *actually responsible* for the crime, would be punished for it.  I 
would be disgusted and horrified if someone used what happened to my 
mother/sister/wife/daughter as an excuse to discriminate against the Trans 
community, in general. The entire mentality of punishing someone for 
another person's crimes, is morally reprehensible to me...and last time I 
checked, was completely un-Constitutional.

And *no*, there's no way to tell if *anyone* is a predator, just by looking 
at them...anyone who thinks they can tell by the way they dress, what kind 
of car they drive, or even how close together their eyes are, or some other 
bullshit...is simply being a self-righteous idiot, trying to justify their 
own vivid imagination.  You can't penalize someone based solely on your own 
prejudice...that shit is just in your head...reality is not the same.

+Mike Stavenes let me ask you a question. Would you think differently if 
your mom, sister or a cousin were to get raped in a women's bathroom by a 
sexual predator pretending to be Transgender? Once again , can you tell the 
difference between a Transgender and a predator masquerading as one? It 
would be nice if you can answer these questions?

+Mike Stavenes seems to me you're not a critical thinker. I'm not blaming 
the Transgender community of anything. I'm saying there are predators out 
there that would take advantage of a law that was intended for the trans 
community. I understand you want to accommodate for every minority out 
there, but eventually there is going to be an issue where we can't because 
it may infringe the right of others or the safety of others.

As for your storm trooper analogy, that's plain stupid and doesn't even 
remotely relate to this issue. Robbing a bank is still illegal regardless 
of what gender, race, age, disbilities or what sexual orientation you are. 
It doesn't matter if you're robbing the store naked or dressing up as Jesus 
and his disciples. Robbing a bank is still illegal. Also the analogy 
doesn't address any opportunities or loopholes that a law can provide to 
criminals. Like how predators can masquerade as Transgendered people to use 
women's restroom. 

So much for being a critical thinker!

+Mike Stavenes seems to me you're not a critical thinker. I'm not blaming 
the Transgender community of anything. I'm saying there are predators out 
there that would take advantage of a law that was intended for the trans 
community. I understand you want to accommodate for every minority out 
there, but eventually there is going to be an issue where we can't because 
it may infringe the right of others or the safety of others.

As for your storm trooper analogy, that's plain stupid and doesn't even 
remotely relate to this issue. Robbing a bank is still illegal regardless 
of what gender, race, age, disbilities or what sexual orientation you are. 
It doesn't matter if you're robbing the store naked or dressing up as Jesus 
and his disciples. Robbing a bank is still illegal. Also the analogy 
doesn't address any opportunities or loopholes that a law can provide to 
criminals. Like how predators can masquerade as Transgendered people to use 
women's restroom. 

So much for being a critical thinker!

+Edward Hughes
So let me see if I understand you properly...you want to blame the Trans 
community for the actions of non-trans perverts?  Nice...great to know 
there's some critical thinking going on there.

If I rob a bank while wearing a stormtrooper costume...are you going to 
blame George Lucas for my actions?  After all, I *did* dress up like one of 
his characters...clearly this is all his fault.
+Edward Hughes Chris Hambrook

+Mike Stavenes it seems that you missed my point. first of all I don't care 
about the lifestyle that Transgendered, bisexual, gay or lesbian people 
choose to live. What I do care about is when their lifestyle infringes the 
safety of my wife and daughter. It's not them to be clear, it is those 
predators that can masquerade as one of them is my concern. Everyone has 
the freedom to live the their lives the way too, just as long as it doesn't 
comprise the safety of others. We can agree that there is a ton of 
predators out there like rapists and pedophiles. Is it hard too believe 
that they would pretend to be Transgender to access the bathroom without 
suspicion for an opportunity to strike an innocent person? There has been 
instances of predators in drag in womens room. Let me be clear, I ain't 
scared of a Transgender, but I am concerned about the safety of my daughter 
and wife if they were to go into the bathroom if Transgender are allowed to 
go. Can you garuntee the safety of my wife and daughter from a predator 
masquerading as a Transgender when they go use the restroom? Can you tell 
the difference between a Transgender and a predator masquerading as one? 
The Women and Children Shelter staff up in Toronto thought Chris Hamrick 
was a sincere Transgender, until he raped two women.

+MegaJdizzle27
Would you think that way if it was you in the minority?  No...you'd believe 
that you had just as much right to be treated with respect as anyone 
else...regardless of whether or not you were different.  That's the whole 
point in freedom...that no matter what you look like, or how you choose to 
live...that you will be respected as an equal.

who the hell said we're scared of Transgendered going to commit a crime in 
there. It's the freaking predators out there that would masquerade as a 
Transgender is what I'm concerned about.

I think the majority of women wouldn't feel comfortable with a Trans person 
in the women's bathroom. Clearly it's bothered enough for it to become a 
problem. I would also question your majority and minority argument. I would 
have to see polls and numbers before I would agree with that.

+Mike Stavenes ok, true and good point. more reason we shouldn't be 
allowing the insignificant minority dictate what the majority wants. .03 of 
the population, do we need to accommodate them? really?

And because it hasn't happened yet, that means that it will never happen. 
Good job.

The most cited reason for support of this bill is safety, so that is what I 
will address.

Imagine the scenario (as I'm sure many supporters already have) that a 
12-year-old girl goes into the ladies' room, and a man follows her in to 
molest her. As rare as bathroom crimes are, they do unfortunately happen. 
Whether or not he is wearing a dress doesn't matter, because the bill has 
absolutely nothing to do with clothing or fashion preference. Assuming that 
this girl doesn't know self defense, there are only two things that might 
stop or prevent this gruesome crime: security cameras and other people 
close enough to hear a little girl scream. If both of these are absent, 
then how will a law dictating which restroom the man can use protect this 
12-year-old girl from getting molested? The penalty for child molestation 
is already far greater than the penalty could ever be for simply walking 
into the "wrong" restroom, which most people have done at least once by 
mistake, anyway.

The truth of the matter is that there is absolutely no evidence indicating 
that bathrooms are in any way safer with this arbitrary law in place. When 
people see inappropriate behavior in the restroom, (like Senator Larry 
Craig taking a "wide stance") they report it immediately, just like they 
would anywhere else. But when they see something they just disapprove of, 
like someone walking in eating a greasy cheeseburger, a rude person talking 
on his cell phone, some butch man or woman wearing chains and tattoos, or 
as simple as someone who looks like he/she could be the opposite gender, 
they either suck it up or go someplace else.

The only thing that this bill protected was Republican interests, at the 
cost of precious time, effort, and a lot of state money, it placed 
transgenders under unnecessary scrutiny and bigotry, and it's based 
entirely on a fabrication. North Carolina's House Representatives abused 
their power to bully a minority of people who have done absolutely nothing 
wrong.

There is, however, one thing that we can ALL do to make public restrooms 
safer: wash your hands after you're done. I am much more concerned about 
how many people I have personally seen who do not wash their hands properly 
after doing their business, because that is a real threat to public health 
and safety, which actually affects other people.﻿
